name: Cajun Seafood Pasta
author: Star Pooley
summary: This recipe is a hot one, but delicious!   If you are weak of tongue, then divide the amounts of peppers in half.  Better to add more than spoil your creation!  Bay scallops are preferred, but the larger sea scallops can be used if they are cut in half.  This dish can also be placed in a casserole dish and placed under the broiler until top turns golden brown!
ingredients: 1 ½ teaspoons crushed red pepper flakes
½ pound shrimp, peeled and deveined
directions: Cook pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente
Meanwhile, pour cream into large skillet
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until just about boiling
Reduce heat, and add herbs, salt, peppers, onions, and parsley
Simmer 7 to 8 minutes, or until thickened
Stir in seafood, cooking until shrimp is no longer transparent
